message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.CL. 

The paper discusses the dynamics of stochastic gradient descent in deep learning, which is a core topic in machine learning. The use of deep convolutional networks in the empirical verification also suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. The proposed model of directional concentration and the use of von Mises-Fisher distribution indicate a focus on statistical analysis, which is relevant to the sub-categories of machine learning (cs.LG), neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE), and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the use of deep learning models for image classification and natural language processing tasks suggests a possible connection to the sub-category of computational linguistics (cs.CL).
